Currently attempting to do a preview update call with PATCH fails,
because we didn't align the behavior of preview update with the
actual update in the recent additions to fix bug #1224828

So, refactor to ensure both preview_update & update use the same

Change-Id: I8ce5c0ea4035a7b9563db10ea10433e7f5f99a4f
Closes-Bug: #1501207

commit_message:
Update preview_update_stack to align with PATCH updates

Currently attempting to do a preview update call with PATCH fails,
because we didn't align the behavior of preview update with the
actual update in the recent additions to fix bug #1224828

So, refactor to ensure both preview_update & update use the same
code, and add a PATCH path to the update API.

Change-Id: I8ce5c0ea4035a7b9563db10ea10433e7f5f99a4f
Closes-Bug: #1501207

subject: Cleaning up module dependency management tree
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-01 16:15:49.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/table/table.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/app.module.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/table/table.module.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/magic-search.module.js'], 'message': "Cleaning up module dependency management tree

In Horizon, angular modules' dependency are managed as a tree, where
a module should only depends on modules defined as `child module`.
Angular built-in modules and modules from third party libraries
will be defined as external dependencies at the allication level
module (top level). This way we know what external dependency the
application has by only looking at the top module definition.

Change-Id: I316bdd3e25ad14d5d316f4835b14657c404654db
"}]
commit_message:
Cleaning up module dependency management tree

In Horizon, angular modules' dependency are managed as a tree, where
a module should only depends on modules defined as `child module`.
Angular built-in modules and modules from third party libraries
will be defined as external dependencies at the allication level
module (top level). This way we know what external dependency the
application has by only looking at the top module definition.

Change-Id: I316bdd3e25ad14d5d316f4835b14657c404654db

The add-to-project and create CA commands can only be performed by
a project administrator when the target CA is either a root CA

Closes-bug: #1501862

commit_message:
Enforce project ownership of subCAs

The add-to-project and create CA commands can only be performed by
a project administrator when the target CA is either a root CA
or a subCA owned by the admin's project.

This CR adds checks to enforce this condition.

Change-Id: Ifbd7bb471b137a5549a8e627344f8f02adda2ed1
Closes-bug: #1501862

commit_message:
Expanded clean command.

This command extends the gulp 'clean' command to scrubbing the
entire project. It's intended for developer use only, in cases where
switching branches requires different dependencies and/or project
structure.

Note that this command will require a subsequent invocation of
'npm install' to return the project to a usable state.

Change-Id: I3b884b98c91617e252b8b373e04e2f019422c1b8

Add a check in the detach_volume() method to see if the instance
is on this host.  In cases where a live migration fails, the
compute manager will attempt to detach each attached volume
from the instance on the destination host, but chances are
the instance is not on the host at all.

Change-Id: I4b3bbd06f653c330f7e52ac7b2190cec2b749e23
'}]
commit_message:
Check instance exists on detach_volume

Add a check in the detach_volume() method to see if the instance
is on this host.  In cases where a live migration fails, the
compute manager will attempt to detach each attached volume
from the instance on the destination host, but chances are
the instance is not on the host at all.

Change-Id: I4b3bbd06f653c330f7e52ac7b2190cec2b749e23

commit_message:
Make metric deletion async

We now delete the metric in two-phases: we first change their status
from 'active' to 'delete', delete them from storage, and then delete
from the indexer definitely.

Closes-Bug: #1486079
Change-Id: Ia1e9661a99c419a5525c00761056564dd8356b9d

commit_message:
Fix openstack module tests

This change reworks the tests for the openstack module so they actually
function. This change includes basic tests for the
openstack::{logging,logrotate,controller,compute} classes. Additionally
some minor lint issues have been addressed to fix errors that were
preventing the syntax checker from passing.

This change is necessary so we can properly test changes when we need to
replace or upgrade some of the module dependencies for the openstack
module.

Partial blueprint: fuel-puppet-librarian

Change-Id: I4e2a1440fb805c3d8519fd242e71717c12cdb24a

subject: Add policy changes required for OSSA-2015-018 / CVE-2015-5240
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-25 18:21:37.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/neutron_common/templates/policy.json'], 'message': 'Add policy changes required for OSSA-2015-018 / CVE-2015-5240

The SHA bump in https://review.openstack.org/224559 included the code fixes
implemented to resolve OSSA-2015-018 / CVE-2015-5240 [1] but did not include
the policy file changes for the same.

This patch implements the policy file changes to finalise the resolution of
the CVE.

[1] https://security.openstack.org/ossa/OSSA-2015-018.html

DocImpact
Change-Id: I13ca7cd1e8c3a9024de447eaa724a2f88d94168d
'}]
commit_message:
Add policy changes required for OSSA-2015-018 / CVE-2015-5240

The SHA bump in https://review.openstack.org/224559 included the code fixes
implemented to resolve OSSA-2015-018 / CVE-2015-5240 [1] but did not include
the policy file changes for the same.

This patch implements the policy file changes to finalise the resolution of
the CVE.

[1] https://security.openstack.org/ossa/OSSA-2015-018.html

DocImpact
Change-Id: I13ca7cd1e8c3a9024de447eaa724a2f88d94168d

commit_message:
Sync with global requirements

* update test requirements with what's in g-r
* Remove hard-coded dependencies from tox.ini as update-requirements
  does not edit tox.ini
* Remove requirements.txt as it is redundant (sdist already has it)
* Fix up all the issues identified by flake8

Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
Change-Id: I0508bd74edda20fbf844e7303c9b44b80ff794ef

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-30 04:39:32.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/functional/api/v2/test_event_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because

Change-Id: Id034b01cff891e928625bb0fa668c1ebd7dcf742
Closes-Bug: #1489062

commit_message:
SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because
the multiple trait query filters are not combined correctly.

Change-Id: Id034b01cff891e928625bb0fa668c1ebd7dcf742
Closes-Bug: #1489062

commit_message:
Using unsupport coe can't create the bay model

Using the unsupport parameter of  coe can create the baymodel,and it is wrong.

The patch prevent the creating baymodel when using the unsupport coe paramenter.

Closes-Bug: #1497134

commit_message:
Check a CA's status as project and preferred CA before deleting

If a CA is preferred and not the last CA of a project, it should
not be deleted.  A user is informed of this with a 409 status code.

Otherwise, the CA can be deleted as well as any record of it in the
CA project list and the CA preferred list.

Change-Id: I9a1ee91252ee17746cfcffd11cba520270d09f21
Closes-bug: #1499876

commit_message:
Add pep8 and bashate non-voting checks to openstack-ansible

This patch adds pep8 and bashate tests to openstack-ansible, but only
applies these tests to branches after juno.

The patch also adds a skip of the non-voting commit check for
document-only commits.

Change-Id: Ieeeae3161d25b4c7a6445a457c02be95b732c5d5

commit_message:
Check if MAC addr is None in validate_mac_address

Previously, validate_mac_address did not check whether the MAC address
was "None" -- this raised a TypeError that was misleading.

This patch refactors the original functions so that the applicable error
messages are displayed.

Made changes based on this abandoned patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181282/4

Change-Id: Ie75fc7c0ee2bec57f5410b07e967d3903f9789d5
Co-Authored-By: Brad Behle <behle@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1452804

commit_message:
Relax factory-boy requirement to >= 2.4.1

We don't need to specify exact version (2.5.2). Furthermore, we don't
even need factory-boy 2.5.x, the APIs used in factories.py can be
satisfied by factory-boy 2.4.1 that is available as a deb package in
Debian jessie and Ubuntu vivid.

Change-Id: I1e82ef3fc5b344d58497a4d4c396e4bc866e310c

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-10-01 14:21:11.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/plugins/test_vpn_connectivity.py', 'rally-jobs/plugins/vpn_base.py', 'rally-jobs/plugins/vpn_utils.py', 'rally-jobs/rally-configs/rally_config.yaml'], 'message': 'VPN Scenario tests using Rally

This patch aims at creating Rally scale tests for VPNaaS.
It tests the full stack creation of VPNaaS -creating actual
networks/routers etc.,

(a)vpn_utils.py contains a set of standalone utility methods to
   create/delete networks, nova instances etc.,
(b)vpn_base.py holds the vpn specific functions to create, delete
   and verify vpn connectivity.
(c)test_vpn_connectivity.py holds the actual scenario.
(d)rally_config.yaml file is the input configuration file

To test this patch:
(1) Install devstack with rally plugin.
(2) Create the following folder structure.
    sudo mkdir /opt/rally
(3) Create a symlink to the plugins directory.
    cd /opt/rally
    sudo ln -s /opt/stack/neutron-vpnaas/rally-jobs/plugins
(4) Run the test
    rally task start <path-to-input-file>
    To see the debug logs,
    rally -vd taks start <path-to-input-file>

Note:
This patch also includes the commit ID cb5e1708 of vpn_utils.py

Change-Id: I28915baf8c4ff07b61e70a33ba63693d65fce80a
'}]
commit_message:
VPN Scenario tests using Rally

This patch aims at creating Rally scale tests for VPNaaS.
It tests the full stack creation of VPNaaS -creating actual
networks/routers etc.,

(a)vpn_utils.py contains a set of standalone utility methods to
   create/delete networks, nova instances etc.,
(b)vpn_base.py holds the vpn specific functions to create, delete
   and verify vpn connectivity.
(c)test_vpn_connectivity.py holds the actual scenario.
(d)rally_config.yaml file is the input configuration file

To test this patch:
(1) Install devstack with rally plugin.
(2) Create the following folder structure.
    sudo mkdir /opt/rally
(3) Create a symlink to the plugins directory.
    cd /opt/rally
    sudo ln -s /opt/stack/neutron-vpnaas/rally-jobs/plugins
(4) Run the test
    rally task start <path-to-input-file>
    To see the debug logs,
    rally -vd taks start <path-to-input-file>

Note:
This patch also includes the commit ID cb5e1708 of vpn_utils.py

commit_message:
Fix LB create and delete VIPs failure when concurrency > 1

Create pools in the scenario instead of context because only one VIP
can be associated for a pool. Thus when concurrency>1 failures are
avoided.

Closes-bug: #1501467
Change-Id: Ibed79807f812a4e46cce0252cfffa8a59624081b

commit_message:
Add TLS support to container handler

This patch sets up the Docker client used by the container handler
to use TLS when communicating with TLS secured Bays.

Implements bp secure-docker

commit_message:
Adding support for public baymodels

- Added a new 'public' column to the baymodel table
- Support for setting the public flag during create or update
- Return all public baymodels when listing baymodels
- Add new rule to policy.json

Partial-Implements: blueprint public-baymodels

Change-Id: I8576e08c504bdbb881306219f573e4a3531ab7fd

commit_message:
Add allowed-address-pairs to port-update

--allowed-address-pair and --no-allowed-address-pairs have been
 newly defined to port-create and port-update.
If you would like to disable allowed-address-pairs, you can use
--no-address-pairs option.

Change-Id: I4811bd1f8d48c34b6d3f20347e4d45625586ac86
Closes-Bug: #1485182

commit_message:
Fix translation issue with interface inputs and functions

Fix the issue with interface inputs described using intrinsic
functions, that produces an invalid HOT output. Also, include
necessary unit tests, and revert templates that were simplified
due to this issue..

This patch includes changes required in heat-translator for
resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I0aa01a05a7e9bf695c10b193023958ec11e4a422
Closes-Bug: #1440247

that have branch labels because we don't maintain per release labels
anymore.

subject: Put in override for Rackspace broken neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-01 18:35:31.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/vendors/rackspace.yaml'], 'message': "Put in override for Rackspace broken neutron

Rackspace puts neutron in the service catalog but it does not work (404s
the endpoint) While it's easy enough to try/except around network calls,
it's also a known fact and can be communicated clearly. Allow things
that want to short-circuit read the value from the config and react
accordingly.

Note: This is not a value going in to the defaults, because the fact
that this is happening at all is highly strange and hopefully something
that can be solved by collaborating on future iterations of DefCore.
However, communicating clearly that it's a known issue is helpful for a
class of users.

Change-Id: I506f4dd397608f2feb6fbda48d297d283312a169
"}]
commit_message:
Put in override for Rackspace broken neutron

Rackspace puts neutron in the service catalog but it does not work (404s
the endpoint) While it's easy enough to try/except around network calls,
it's also a known fact and can be communicated clearly. Allow things
that want to short-circuit read the value from the config and react
accordingly.

Note: This is not a value going in to the defaults, because the fact
that this is happening at all is highly strange and hopefully something
that can be solved by collaborating on future iterations of DefCore.
However, communicating clearly that it's a known issue is helpful for a
class of users.

Change-Id: I506f4dd397608f2feb6fbda48d297d283312a169

commit_message:
Support passing force_ipv4 to the constructor

IPv6 support is detectable, so rather than having a user opt-in to it,
provide a flag that can be provided to tell it that detected IPv6
support is lying. This should have to be set for far fewer people and
should result in transparent opt-in to IPv6 where available.

Change-Id: Ib0c4c4e8b3b7b4bcee5fa3414719969274929b9a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 23:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'message': "Enable no-undefined

Disallow Use of undefined Variable (no-undefined)

The undefined variable is unique in JavaScript because it is
actually a property of the global object. As such, in ECMAScript 3
it was possible to overwrite the value of undefined. While
ECMAScript 5 disallows overwriting undefined, it's still possible
to shadow undefined

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-undefined

Change-Id: I49bc0c26c19cbb7f12810066bdb8afc292c814bf
"}]
commit_message:
Enable no-undefined

Disallow Use of undefined Variable (no-undefined)

The undefined variable is unique in JavaScript because it is
actually a property of the global object. As such, in ECMAScript 3
it was possible to overwrite the value of undefined. While
ECMAScript 5 disallows overwriting undefined, it's still possible
to shadow undefined

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-undefined

Change-Id: I49bc0c26c19cbb7f12810066bdb8afc292c814bf

commit_message:
Stop checking for E129

"E129 visually indented line with same indent as next logical line"
is not particularly useful. Different editors have varying default
behaviors here and following it doesn't really increase readability
in significant ways (if at all).
